name: Legal specialist, Samara
description:
Responsibilities:
  • Structure, draft, review, and occasionally negotiate of services, subcontracting and supply contracts, client contracts, NDA's, Linde standardized terms and conditions, as also other contract types;
  • Check legal documents on compliance with the Russian legislation;
  • Track and register digitized contracts signed over electronic signature platform (such as Diadok) and archive final executed contractual documents in paper form;
  • Support on dispute resolution and litigation where appropriate;
  • Assess and support resolution of commercial disputes and any related legal proceedings;
  • Provide day-to-day legal advice in reliance on the Russian legislation and ensure clear and timely responses on legal queries;
  • Proactively identify, evaluate and address legal, ethics and compliance risks, and work with team leads to develop risk mitigation and/or corrective action plans, as appropriate;
  • Supporting the implementation of company policies and procedures;
  • Represent the business before regulatory agencies, including enforcement proceedings, administrative hearings and preparation and review of permit applications;
  • Draft, review, register and achieve Power of Attorneys;
  • Ensure notary certification or state registration of documents and certain types of agreements.
Requirements:
  • 4-5 years of experience in a law firm / in house lawyer of an engineering or construction company;
  • experience in construction subcontracting;
  • university degree in law;
  • good computer skills
  • excellent communication, verbal and written, and drafting skills
  • understands basis contracting principles with ability to read and analyze mid and high complexity contracts;
  • previous experience drafting and negotiating complex business transactions, including licensing deals;
  • ability to set priorities and juggle multiple demands;
  • strong time management skills and ability to manage self and/or teams delivery commitments with professional and positive attitude;
  • strong problem-solving skills, pragmatism and flexibility/resilience;
  • previous experience prioritizing conflicting demands from multiple business clients in an extremely fast-paced environment;
  • ability to advise and interact with all levels of management;
  • ability to communicate using English and Russian and outstanding interpersonal skills
  • We are looking for candidates who share our values reflected in the Linde Code of Ethics and principles: security, honesty, stability, respect;
  • We expect all Linde employees to act in accordance with the Company's laws and internal procedures.
Conditions:
  • Attractive compensation package;
  • Professional education;
  • Business trips are possible;
  • Place of work - Samara.
